subtitles.text: How are you doing?
I am Mizuki Fukumura, sub-leader of Morning Musume。 s sub-leader, Mizuki Fukumura.
I will be your MC this time. Please give me your best regards.
I am 16 years old now, but I will turn 17 on October 30.
My hobby is taking pictures of elevator buttons and collecting them,
Thanks for watching this video.
Hallo! This time, I'm going to meet Mizuki Fukumura, a member of Morning Musume。 23's Mizuki Fukumura and
Rina Ikuta from Morning Musume。 23, and Rina Ikuta from Morning Musume。
Mizuki Fukumura is going to be the last MC for Hallo! I'm Mizuki Fukumura, the last MC for Halo!
I was wearing my favorite outfit at that time.
I was wearing my favorite dress at that time... and what I was saying was the same.
It's surprising to see the two of us MCing at the Halloween party. It's also the first time for the two of us to MC at Halo!
I hope we can do what only the two of us can do.
And now, Morning Musume。 23 Concert Tour Autumn Neverending Employee of the Year Award.
How are you feeling right now? How are you feeling right now?
I can't believe it, but I'm having so much fun on this fall tour.
I don't remember when a month went by so fast... but I'm having so much fun, and it's so rewarding and fun.
I feel like I'm having a lot of fun, and I'm having a lot of fun, and I'm having a lot of fun, and I'm having a lot of fun, and I'm having a lot of fun.
I'd like to cherish the moments when I make eye contact with the members or when I have a call and response with the fans even more.
Personally, with the Corona Disaster, I've been in a situation where I couldn't speak and couldn't stand up.
I feel like we're finally back to a normal world where it's okay to speak up and the audience is allowed to stand.
It's finally back to the normal world where it's OK to shout and the audience is allowed to stand.
I'm personally happy to be able to welcome Mizuki's graduation performance in the usual way, with standing room only and with the ability to speak up.
I'm also very happy that we are going to have a new organization in the future.
How do you want us to see you in the future? It will be the first time to see the 14 of us at Yokohama Arena, and we will see Morning Musume with 13 members.
Well... I feel that I spent a very precious time during the past 6 months from when I joined the 17th term until my graduation.
I wonder what I want to tell the 17th term members about that. I wonder if I wouldn't have been able to tell them if I hadn't decided to graduate.
I have told them things that I think I might not have been able to tell them if I hadn't decided to graduate.
I hope that they will inherit my impression of Morning Musume, but I also hope that when I see the 17th term in about six months, my impression of them will be very different.

I personally think that the members I see up close and the members I see from afar with an objective view are different. I personally think that the members I see up close are different from the members I see from afar with an objective view.
I hope that all of you fans will continue to love Morning Musume even after there are 14 of us and 13 of Mizuki, too.

Mizuki Fukumura and Erina Ikuta of Morning Musume。 23 present "Halo! STE, presented by Mizuki Fukumura and Erina Ikuta of Morning Musume 23.Mizuki Fukumura and Erina Ikuta of Morning Musume。23 present "Halo! Ste.
Morning Musume。23 Concert Tour Autumn next Wednesday, November 29th at Yokohama Arena.
Neverending Employee Show Sanctuary: Mizuki Fukumura's Graduation Special will be held at Yokohama Arena next Wednesday, November 29.
I'd like to ask Mizuki a few questions about her upcoming graduation.
Well, you know, there's only one week left until graduation.
How do you feel?
You know, we're all graduating from now on.
I'd like to say something, but I really don't have time.
I've been thinking about this since June.
We've been working on it since June.
But right before the graduation, there was an overflow of work.
I've been working from morning till night.
I've been working from morning till night, so I haven't been able to finish at all.
Also, I'd like to write letters and stuff like that.
But I haven't finished that at all at this moment.
I don't know what to think about.
I don't know...
I wonder if I'm saying thank you to all the people I want to say thank you to.
I'm getting more and more anxious.
I don't know how to put it, but I'm in such a hurry.
Each day goes by so fast.
But I want to take each step forward.
I want to make sure that the time for the concert is just right.
I don't want to show that kind of rushed feeling
I don't want to show that kind of impatience.
I want to cherish the time I have with the members.
I want to finish my work at home.
I want to spend time with my members in a way that's important to me.
I want to spend time with the members.
I don't know how to put it.I don't know what I would say too much.
I don't really feel that I'm going to stop being a member of Morning Musume。 I still don't really feel that I'm not Morning Musume。
But for now...
I wrote "Morning Musume。23" before.
But it's the last time I'm going to write Morning Musume。
It's going to be my original name.
I'd like to say something now.

A sense of accomplishment.

From the Budokan stage in the spring of 2015.
Oh, gradations?
Gradation?

After Sayumi Michishige, the previous leader, graduated.

I wondered if we would be suitable for this stage.
I wondered if we would fit in on this stage.
We were all very anxious.

Lastly, do you have a message for the fans, the viewers, and the people who will be coming to the concert, the graduation concert at Yokohama Arena on the second day?
Yes, I've been performing for about 15 years, including my time as a member of Halo Pro Egg, so thank you very much for your support.
Thank you very much.
I don't really know what's going to happen to me now that I've been living with Morning Musume, but I never stopped thinking about it.
But because I never stopped thinking about it, I'm going to take a break from thinking about it after graduation.
I hope to face myself again, experience various things, and enrich my life.
I hope that my life will become richer and more fulfilling.
I hope I can improve my skills
I hope to be able to come back again when I have improved my skills.
I will graduate on November 29th.
I would like to express my gratitude to all of you, and I love the call and response with my fans.
I love the call and response with my fans, so I hope to get a lot of cheers from them on the day.
